Submodules¶

ovs.tests.unittests.base_test module¶

The base test case that all other test cases should inherit from

class ovs.tests.unittests.base_test.MockBcrypt(app=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Mock the Bcrypt object to avoid expensive security stuff during testing.

__init__(app=None)[source]¶

Does nothing. :param app: Unused.

check_password_hash(pw_hash, password)[source]¶

Since we aren’t hashing passwords logging in is as simple as comparing plaintext. :param pw_hash: The password the user typed in. :param password: The password the account has.

Returns:True if they are the same.
Return type:bool
generate_password_hash(password, rounds=None)[source]¶

Mock generate_password_hash to speed up tests. :param password: The password to not hash. :param rounds: The number of rounds Bcrypt would have applied a hash.

Returns:password
init_app(app)[source]¶

Does nothing. :param app: Unused.

class ovs.tests.unittests.base_test.OVSBaseTestCase(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: flask_testing.utils.TestCase

The base test case that all other test cases should inherit from

create_app()[source]¶

Creates a Flask app for use during each test. :returns: a unique flask app for this test. :rtype: Flask

setUp()[source]¶

Runs before every test and clears relevant tables

tearDown()[source]¶

Runs after every tests and clears relevant tables. Subclasses should override this if they require additional teardown code to be run
